text: my name is jagdish people call me jags
for short
i'm a principal solutions architect i
work in the enterprise team i started my
career about 25 years ago
as a hardware engineer looking after
computers and printers then i moved into
unix and storage administration so i've
been at aws for
over four years now i interviewed for a
storage specialist role because of my
background in storage infrastructure
but during my interview i expressed
interest to be
a more generalist essay and work across
different technologies so by the time i
joined i actually joined an as an
account essay i was pleasantly surprised
when i joined to have a lot of helpful
team members and anyone who i meet i
could go and ask for help and everyone
was very helpful for such a large
organization i didn't know what to
expect we have this ramp up period
during drama periods when i started
focusing on
not only services but also i started
with python and started with just basics
and then looking at code examples and
then building on so that's what helped
me and even after the rampant period
when you start working with customers we
are encouraged to dedicate about 20 of
the time for self-development and
learning i would say
if you're interested in technology and
like learning this is one of the best
places to be in
